issue.title: [MATLAB] Add support for building the MATLAB interface using multi-configuration generators
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15182](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15182). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
For multi-configuration generators, the binaries are built into a subdirectory indicating the build configuration. 
1. In `{}CMakeLists.txt{`}, create a text file, `{}is_multi_config.txt{`}, and place it in the top level build directory. This file should lists the configuration used.
1. Use this configuration text file in MATLAB test files to ensure they are able to find the MEX binaries.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15182?focusedCommentId=17492148) by Fiona La (fionala):*
This task is no longer applicable. The installation step will add the install directory to the [MATLAB Search Path](https://mathworks.com/help/matlab/matlab_env/what-is-the-matlab-search-path.html) either directly or by adding a command to the `startup.m` file that is used, by default, on MATLAB start up.
